STYLE.NAME: Belgian Dark Strong Ale
STYLE.NOTES: Full bodied, deep brown color Belgian ales. Many variations, but most are malty, alcoholic and fruity. Most versions reflect unique character of the breweries.
STYLE.PROFILE: Full bodied, sweet, malty beer. Low to moderate hop flavor and aroma. Brown color from dark Candi sugar. May be spicy and phenolic. High carbonation.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Belgian malt. Munich or caramel malt. Dark candi sugar usually provides color and increases gravity. Spices rarely used Unique yeasts to produce fruity esters and phenols. Avoid US/UK crystal malts.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Rouchefort 10, Westvleteren 12, Chimay Grande Reserve, Gouden Carolus Grand Cru of the Emporer, Abbaye des Rocs Grand Cru, Gulden Draak Kasterbier Biere du Chateau Donker
